column1: Gennevilliers (French pronunciation: ​[ʒœnvilje]) is a commune in the northwestern suburbs of Paris
column2: in the Hauts-de-Seine department of Île-de-France. It is located 9.1 km (5.7 mi) from the centre of Paris. In 2017
one-fifth of the territory of Gennevilliers was detached and became the commune of Villeneuve-la-Garenne. Gennevilliers is the site of the main river port Port of Gennevilliers of Paris on the Seine.

column1: Gennevilliers is served by three stations on Paris Métro Line 13: Les Courtilles
column2: Les Agnettes and Gabriel Péri. All three are at the border with the commune of Asnières-sur-Seine.

column1: Gennevilliers is also served by two stations on RER C (Les Grésillons and Gennevilliers)
column2: as well as five stops on Île-de-France tramway Line 1.

column3: Collège Louis-PasteurThere is a senior high school
